page.title: 11RAILWAY STATIONS, LINCOLN.
page.content: The{Central Station}opened in{1848}the first train running to {Peterborough. Its newly cleaned exterior is unusual and was designed to 'blend' with the castle and the Cathedral. Inside, the usual amenities have been given a face lift because of Central's new importance after the closure of{St. {Mark's.}There is a new glass roof and the ironwork is bright red.The waiting rooms are yellow and the offices red and grey. Roughly{110 trains per day now pass through and there is an air of activity. Two freight trains carrying tankers passed within 10 minutes.Only{2 level crossings}remain, one of them across the busy High St. {St. Mark's Station}closed in{May 1985. the last train left for {Nottingham amidst railway enthusiasts anxious to record the event on camera. Thirty acres of land are up for sale.
